titles.title: Federal Travel Transparency Act

A bill to amend section 5707 of title 5, United States Code, to require the General Services Administration to make information regarding travel by the heads of Executive agencies and other individuals in senior positions publicly available.
Federal Travel Transparency Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary:
Federal Travel Transparency Act
This bill requires a federal executive agency to report additional information to the General Services Administration (GSA) regarding travel by the agency head or certain high-level officials compensated on the Executive Schedule. The GSA must make the information publicly available on a travel information website.
